TopicTitle: [0.23] Alternis Kerbol - Release thread - [v0.1, Jan. 3] (development halted)

Articles.Content: I'm still alive and well, It's just that I feel that I can't keep trying to fix this thing like patchwork every new patch and that a new long term solution is needed. Anyone can take my work a few threads back and do whatever you want with it. As for now I'm giving up.

Has anyone thought about putting together a Kopernicus config once that's done? I've got one that just rescales and shifts the planets, but once Kopernicus adds PQS support to the configs it should be possible to set up the system and hopefully avoid most of the bugs that Alternis had from the beginning.
That is the plan, I believe.
Well, this mod still works in 0.24.5

Well, this mod still works in 0.24.5

There is no 0.24.5...

Yeah, Alternis will be ported to Kopernicus once it reaches a suitable state. But in the meantime, I will release a less buggy version of Alternis that I had in the works once I get my computer fixed.

Does anyone know what the altitude for a kerbin synchronous orbit is? I'm trying to set up a Communication satellite in my career mode save, but I had some trouble when I realized that one rotation is about 2days instead of 6 hours.

Does anyone know what the altitude for a kerbin synchronous orbit is? I'm trying to set up a Communication satellite in my career mode save, but I had some trouble when I realized that one rotation is about 2days instead of 6 hours.

Assuming it runs, I don't think you can; not really at least. The best I was able to do was a synchronous orbit a ways behind Kerbin around Jool. I suspect the altitude needed is outside the SoI, but that was a bit of a seat of the pants save, so i'm not certain.

Ahem, now my rant is over, the proper way to refer to the current version is "0.90" If you say 0.9, you are referring to the legacy alpha version that was released on August 12, 2011, when KSP was somewhat as recognizable as it is today, but still had a long ways to go.

I'm reporting a bug that's happened to me several times. Whenever I reach the vicinity of Laythe, I always end up either being hurled at the surface at maybe 10,000 m/s or exploding in orbit. I'm not sure if it's just with the other mods I have or something else. Also, it tends to explode more often when I use HyperEdit, and I've already tested it at several different altitudes and still.

Has anybody picked this up?

Because this was an amazing mod when the version was not .90

I guess it could be remade with KopernicusTech. I'll have a go if I have time, since all it would need is the art assets (height and color maps) which have a permitting license.

I think KopernicusTech is in the mostly stable state that the people one or two pages back, and half a year ago, were looking for. If there is anyone who is still maintaining / has ownership of the mod right now, I'd be happy to work with you. Looking at the assets, the only problem I can see is the Laythe color map is not in a useable state. I think it uses the same height based colors as Kerbin, though.
